Description: Wooden sickle with blade composed of flints(some now lost); Hieroglyphic inscription.
Curator's comments: Published: Kees, A.Z. 85 (1960) pp. 445ff. Dewachter. Rd'E 35 (1984). pp. 91ff. BMS Bulletin, Summer 1988, No. 58. G. Hart. Eyewitness Guides; Ancient Egypt. (1990). p. 9. M. Stead. Egyptian Life. (1994). fig. 36. N. Strudwick, The Legacy of Lord Carnarvon, Wyoming 2001, p. 29 [25]. PM I Part 2: p.846
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens Commoners of the New Kingdom 2006/8 Sept-Sept, Wallsend, Segedunum Roman Fort & Baths Museum, Egypt Revealed
Acquisition name: Donated by: George Herbert, 5th Earl of Carnarvon
